I write as counsel to Jeffrey Epstein, the subject of a 
grand jury investigation being 
conducted by your office. 
I understand from you that in the next month or two a decision will be made by your 
office whether to seek an indictment of Mr. Epstein. This will confirm that, prior to any such 
decision being made, I 
and other attorneys on behalf of Mr. Epstein will be given an opportunity 
to meet with 
you. 
Additionally, because we believe that any decision to indict requires both a complex 
legal 
analysis in a detailed factual context and resolution of significant policy concerns, if 
our 
n
does not resolve the matter, we would like an o rtuni to make a 
presentation first to 
Chief of the 
Criminal 
Division, 
and First Assistant United States 
Attorney, and then, again, if no resolution is reached, the 
opportunity to meet with United States
